awd_titl_txt: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2022 UChicago AI+Science Summer School (UChicago AI+Sci SS)
awd_abstract_narration:
The University of Chicago Data Science Institute’s AI+Science initiative, in partnership with the Institute for Mathematical and Statistical Innovation (IMSI), the James Franck Institute (JFI) at the University of Chicago, and the Institute for Foundations of Data Science (IFDS), will launch its inaugural AI+Science Summer School in August 2022. The goal of the AI+Science Summer School is to introduce a new generation of diverse, interdisciplinary graduate students, postdoctoral scholars, and researchers to the emerging field of AI+Science. The AI+Science Summer School will help build community and spur new research directions focused on AI-enabled scientific discovery across the physical and biological sciences. The program features lectures, panels, hands-on coding sessions, and poster sessions. The featured workshop speakers include cutting-edge researchers both from UChicago and other institutions who are engaging in rigorous work at the intersection of AI and the natural sciences in a range of domains. The AI+Science Summer School will serve as one of the inaugural activities under the UChicago Data Science Institute to establish and build the AI+Science community, both on the UChicago campus and beyond. Travel scholarships for participating students lower the barrier for participation to students who might not otherwise be able to attend, and serve the mission stated above by including as many capable and qualified participants as possible in this effort to advance the field of AI+Science while simultaneously building community and providing opportunity.

The goal of the AI+Science Summer School is to introduce a new generation of diverse, interdisciplinary graduate students, postdoctoral scholars, and researchers to the emerging field of AI+Science. The topics covered in the Summer School will focus on four core themes at the heart of this emerging paradigm of scientific discovery: AI uncovering new laws of nature; AI guiding scientific measurement; physics-informed machine learning; and scientific discovery advancing AI frontiers. The AI+Science Summer School will help build community and spur new research directions focused on AI-enabled scientific discovery across the physical and biological sciences. Topics of the summer school will include: physics-informed and -constrained neural networks; AI for geosciences and climate modeling; AI-guided search in chemistry and molecular biology; tensor networks for classical and quantum systems; active learning and AI-guided experimental design. Travel grants will be awarded to 10-15 participating students in the AI+Science Summer School. The participants who are awarded travel scholarships will be at least 50% women, other underrepresented minorities, and first generation college students.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering
org_div_long_name: Division of Computing and Communication Foundations

por.por_cntn:
Project Outcomes Report: NSF Student Travel Grant for 2022 UChicago AI+Science Summer School

Introduction

The 2022 and 2023 AI+Science Summer Schools at the University of Chicago, funded by the NSF Student Travel Grant, were transformative initiatives aimed at introducing diverse groups of graduate students, postdoctoral scholars, and researchers to the rapidly evolving field of AI+Science. This project brought together interdisciplinary teams from various scientific domains to explore the integration of artificial intelligence (AI) in scientific discovery, promoting both intellectual merit and broader impacts.

Intellectual Merit

The AI+Science Summer School focused on several core themes central to the emerging paradigm of AI-enabled scientific discovery. These included:

  1. AI Uncovering New Laws of Nature: AI techniques, particularly machine learning and neural networks, are leveraged to uncover underlying patterns and laws in complex datasets from various scientific fields.

  2. AI Guiding Scientific Measurement: AI is used to optimize experimental design and measurement processes, enhancing the precision and efficiency of scientific investigations.

  3. Physics-Informed Machine Learning: Incorporating physical laws and constraints into AI models to improve their accuracy and reliability in scientific applications.

  4. Scientific Discovery Advancing AI Frontiers: Scientific challenges drive advancements in AI methodologies, leading to more robust and generalizable AI models.

Key accomplishments in these areas were demonstrated through a series of lectures and hands-on sessions led by renowned experts in AI, machine learning, and various scientific disciplines. Topics covered included physics-informed neural networks, AI for geosciences and climate modeling, tensor networks for quantum systems, and Bayesian active learning for experimental design​​.

Broader Impacts

The broader impacts of the AI+Science Summer School were significant and multifaceted:

  1. Interdisciplinary Collaboration: The program fostered collaborations between computer scientists, mathematicians, statisticians, engineers, and domain scientists from fields such as physics, chemistry, biology, and environmental science. This cross-pollination of ideas is essential for addressing complex scientific challenges using AI​.

  2. Educational and Professional Development: Over 136 students participated in the 2022 summer school, gaining exposure to cutting-edge research and methodologies. The program included lectures, panel discussions, and networking opportunities, enhancing participants' knowledge and professional networks. Students also had the chance to present their research through poster sessions and lightning talks, receiving feedback from leading experts in the field​.

  3. Online Dissemination: Multiple lectures were recorded and made available online, extending the reach of the program to a global audience. This open-access approach ensures that the knowledge and insights shared during the summer school benefit a wider community of researchers and educators​.

  4. Workforce Development: By training the next generation of scientists and researchers in the application of AI to scientific discovery, the program contributes to the development of a workforce equipped with the skills necessary for future scientific and technological advancements​​.

Summary of Outcomes

The 2022 and 2023 AI+Science Summer School programs successfully met their goals by:

  • Providing interdisciplinary training in AI and its applications to scientific discovery.

  • Promoting collaboration across scientific disciplines.

  • Enhancing the educational and professional development of participants.

  • Disseminating knowledge through online resources.

The programs' impact on both the scientific community and society at large underscores the importance of integrating AI into scientific research and education. As we look forward to future summer schools, we anticipate further advancements in AI+Science, driven by the collaborative and innovative spirit fostered by this initiative.

For more details on the program and access to recorded lectures, please visit the AI+Science 2022 Summer School website​ and the 2023 AI+Science Summer School website​.


Last Modified: 10/06/2024
Modified by: Rebecca M Willett
